Class FileStorage

java.lang.Object
server.FileStorage
public class FileStorage extends Object
FileStorage is responsible for persistent storage of player ratings (MMR).

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    FileStorage()
    Initializes the file storage and loads existing ratings from file.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    int
    getMmr(String username)
    Returns the MMR of a given user.

    getRankingsForProtocol()
    Returns player rankings formatted for protocol transmission.
    void
    load()
    Loads player ratings from the file.
    void

    Saves all current ratings to the file.
    void
    updateMmr(String username, int point)
    Updates the MMR of a user by adding the given number of points.

    Methods inherited from class Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • FileStorage

      public FileStorage()
      Initializes the file storage and loads existing ratings from file.

  • Method Details

    • load

      public void load()
      Loads player ratings from the file.

      If the file does not exist, it is created automatically. Each line is expected to follow the format: username:mmr

    • save

      public void save()
      Saves all current ratings to the file. Each rating is written in the format: username:mmr

    • getMmr

      public int getMmr(String username)
      Returns the MMR of a given user.
      Parameters:
      username - player username
      Returns:
      stored MMR value, or 1000 if the user is not found

    • updateMmr

      public void updateMmr(String username, int point)
      Updates the MMR of a user by adding the given number of points. The resulting MMR value cannot be negative. After updating, the ratings are saved to file.
      Parameters:
      username - player username
      point - MMR change (positive or negative)

    • getRankingsForProtocol

      public String getRankingsForProtocol()
      Returns player rankings formatted for protocol transmission. Rankings are sorted in descending order of MMR.
      Returns:
      protocol-formatted rankings string
